info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 7:02AM EDT until April 3 at 8:09PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following streams in Indiana...
Sugar Creek at New Palestine.
Haw Creek near Clifford.
Youngs Creek at Amity.
Big Blue River at Carthage.
.Minor to moderate flooding is expected to continue into this weekend following additional moderate to heavy rainfall this week.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Sugar Creek at New Palestine.
* WHEN...From this morning to this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Extensive flooding along Sugar Creek in southern Hancock and western Shelby Counties. After reaching this level, and when the Big Blue River was near 16.5 feet, one day later several homes along the creek west of Shelbyville were evacuated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM EDT Thursday was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.8 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this afternoon by around 315 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING
